meanings.definition: The act of entering or going in.
meanings.sent1: The ingress of the students into the classroom was noisy.
meanings.sent2: Please use the ingress on the left side of the building.
meanings.sent3: The ingress of the cat through the window surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The ingress of new ideas can lead to great innovation.
meanings.sent5: The bright red door marked the ingress to the magical world.

meanings.definition: The right or permission to enter.
meanings.sent1: Without the proper ingress, you cannot access the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: Visitors must show their ingress pass at the gate.
meanings.sent3: The golden key granted him ingress to the secret garden.
meanings.sent4: Education is the key that provides ingress to a better future.
meanings.sent5: The VIP ticket granted special ingress to the exclusive event.

meanings.definition: A means or place of entering.
meanings.sent1: The grand entrance served as the main ingress to the palace.
meanings.sent2: The small gate was the only ingress to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The revolving door provided a fun ingress to the office building.
meanings.sent4: The bridge served as the only ingress to the island.
meanings.sent5: The secret tunnel was the hidden ingress to the underground hideout.
